descript.abstract:
Four criteria have been recognized by Virginia's Forest Lgeacy Program (FLP) as contributors to high conservation value: 1) Threatened by conversion to non-forest use (fragmentation and reduction in linkages) 2) Continued production of timber and other forest commodities (local and regional economic base) 3) Consideration of natural heritage resources (e.g. natural communities, habitat for rare, threatened, & endangered species, significant geologic features) 4) Watershed values (water quality, wetlands, riparian buffers, groundwater recharge, public water supply)
Two key goals were identified as part of this analysis: (1) ensure that all four eligibility criteria are represented equally in a statewide conservation score and (2) present the data at a landscape scale. First, we identified the following priority areas as having some contribution to the four eligibility criteria: Streams, shorelines, and floodplain forests and forested wetlands Forests in headwaters and on steep slopes Forest protecting drinking water supplies Large contiguous blocks of forest; and Sustainable, managed working forests Areas of high terrestrial integrity Areas of high aquatic integrity Forests threatened by conversion
We gathered GIS datasets that represent each priority area and quantified the degree to which each priority area reflected one or more of the eligibility criteria. Based on those values a weighted overlay model was developed representing conservation value. The scale of analysis was generally 1:100,000 and was conducted at a 30-meter raster resolution. Next, statistics were run to determine the conservation value of each hydrologic unit in the state in order to present the data at a landscape scale. Finally, we identified a conservation value threshold that served as the boundary between those forestlands that do and do not qualify for the FLP.
descript.purpose: The objective of this analysis is to identify forestlands in Virginia of relatively high conservation value that qualify for the Forest Legacy Program (FLP) .

theme.themekt: REQUIRED: Reference to a formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of theme keywords.
